titlealts.searchtitle: NHS Business Definition: Holistic Needs Assessment - Description

div.p: A Holistic Needs Assessment (HNA) is a CARE CONTACT.

For the Cancer Outcomes and Services Data Set, a Holistic Needs Assessment is the process of gathering and discussing information with the PATIENT and/or Carer/supporter in order to develop an understanding of what the person living with and beyond cancer knows, understands and needs.
Provides an opportunity for the person to think through their needs and, together with their healthcare professional, to make a plan about how to best meet these
Helps people to self-manage their condition
Helps teams to target support and care efforts and work more efficiently by making appropriate and informed decisions.
